## Who I Am

I am a Data Science M.S. student at American University with a strong interest in natural language processing, machine learning, and large-scale data analytics. My work focuses on transforming complex, real-world data into actionable insights while building responsible and interpretable AI systems.

---

## What I Work On

- Natural Language Processing (NLP) & AI Ethics  
- Machine Learning & Statistical Modeling  
- Big Data Systems & Distributed Data Processing  
- Data Engineering & Analytics Pipelines  

---

## How I Think & Work

I care deeply about the interpretability, fairness, and ethical implications of data-driven systems. I enjoy working at the intersection of technical rigor and real-world impact, and I value reproducible workflows, clear communication, and collaborative problem-solving.

---

## Beyond Work

Outside of my academic and professional work, I enjoy participating in global education initiatives, attending technical conferences, and exploring interdisciplinary research that connects data science with societal challenges.
